abstract: couple 's blazing row accidentally caught on camera during live channel 4 news broadcast .
article: furious arguments in public are commonplace for couples . what 's not commonplace is furious arguments being caught on camera , or even worse -- on the channel 4 news camera . one unidentified couple were unfortunate enough to be captured live during a channel 4 news segment , while columnist andrew pierce was speaking to presenter cathy newman about a censorship row between the daily mail and virgin trains . when you have a domestic live on the @channel4news 🤣 🤣 🤣 pic . twitter . com/vhuifobkl3 -- jack kavanagh ⚒️ january 9 , 2018 . as pierce was speaking to cathy and guardian columnist dawn foster in the studio , car horns and faint yelling could be heard off camera .

seconds later , a man and woman screaming at each other walk straight into shot behind pierce . as they shout expletives , pierce says : `` i 'm terribly sorry about the distraction behind -- ca n't really help that one . `` cathy adds : `` there seems to be some sort of fight going on behind , so let me just go back to dawn foster . `` as the camera returns to the studio , dawn is seen attempting to stifle her giggles while newman tries to move on . channel 4 . `` the argument going on in the back of @channel4news debate with daily mail was classic , '' one viewer wrote .

another joked : `` terribly sad to see a couple split up live on tv like that . `` terribly sad to see a couple split up live on tv like that @channel4news 😂 😂 -- james tipping january 9 , 2018 . the argument going on in the back of @channel4news debate with daily mail was classic 😂 -- charlie january 9 , 2018 . ooh dear - mid interview cut to this - did someone say something they should n't @channel4news ? pic . twitter . com/exhsq7is5l -- david reader january 9 , 2018 .
